message.content:
cs.DB, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.OS, cs.PL 

This paper is about logging techniques for in-memory databases, which is a topic closely related to database systems (cs.DB). The paper also discusses distributed recovery, which falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC). The use of command logging and its impact on performance is a topic that can be classified under data structures (cs.DS) and operating systems (cs.OS). Finally, the paper proposes an adaptive logging approach, which involves optimizing the performance of transaction processing and recovery, a topic that can be classified under programming languages (cs.PL).
